		<title>CBS Cancels Last Remaining 'CSI' Series: See the Full List of This Season's Axed Network Shows</title>
		<link rel="alternative" href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/cbs-cancels-final-csi-series-see-list-of-this-seasons-axed-shows-w206322"/>
		<updated>1969-12-31T19:00:00Z</updated>
		<published>2016-05-12T17:58:00Z</published>
		<id>http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/cbs-cancels-final-csi-series-see-list-of-this-seasons-axed-shows-w206322</id>
		<summary type="text">The once-mighty CSI franchise is now in the past, with CBS canceling 'CSI: Cyber' on Thursday, May 11 — see the full list of 2014-2015 series that have been dropped so far by the major networks</summary>
		<content type="html"><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">Gone cold! A storied TV franchise is now in the ground, with CBS announcing on Thursday, May 11, that the final remaining <i>CSI</i> series, <i>CSI: Cyber</i>, has been canceled after two seasons.</span><br></p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="1"></wm:embed><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">The crime procedural starred</span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;"> <a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrities/patricia-arquette">Patricia Arquette</a></b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">, </span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;">Ted Danson</b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">, </span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;">James Van Der Beek</b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"> and </span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;">Shad Moss</b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">. It premiered in March 2015, just weeks after Arquette nabbed her first-ever Oscar (best supporting actress) for her role in </span><i style="line-height: 1.42857;">Boyhood</i><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">.</span><br></p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="2"></wm:embed><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">The decision to ax </span><i style="line-height: 1.42857;">Cyber</i><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"> leaves the TV world without a </span><i style="line-height: 1.42857;">CSI </i><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">series for the first time since the flagship show &#x2014; once the most watched program in the country &#x2014; launched in October 2000.</span><br></p><p>The original <i>CSI</i> signed off with a two-hour TV movie in September 2015 after 15 seasons. <i>CSI: Miami </i>premiered in September 2002 and lasted 10 seasons, while <i>CSI: New York </i>debuted in September 2004 and aired nine seasons.</p><p></p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="3"></wm:embed><p><i style="line-height: 1.42857;">Cheers</i><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"> vet Danson has already <a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/ted-danson-is-leaving-csi-cyber-is-this-the-end-of-the-franchise-w161540">lined up his next gig</a>, as NBC announced in January that he was going back to his sitcom roots to join </span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;">Kristen Bell</b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"> as a series regular in </span><i style="line-height: 1.42857;">The</i><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">&#xA0;</span><i style="line-height: 1.42857;">Good Place</i><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">. The new sitcom from</span><i style="line-height: 1.42857;"> Parks and Recreation </i><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">cocreator </span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;">Michael Schur</b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"> landed a 13-episode straight-to-series order.</span><br></p><p></p><p></p><wm:media type="photo" id="1"></wm:media><p></p><p></p><p>The full list of series from the 2014&#x2013;2015 season that have won&apos;t be returning to the five major networks (ABC, CBS, Fox, NBC and The CW) is below. CBS&apos; <i>Mike &amp; Molly </i>and <i>The Good Wife</i> and Fox&apos;s <i>American Idol</i> are among the notable shows in the group. Additionally,<i> Supergirl </i>is switching from CBS to the CW.</p><wm:embed type="related"></wm:embed><p><b style="line-height: 1.42857;">ABC</b><br></p><p><i>Agent Carter</i></p><p><i>The Astronaut Wives Club</i></p><p><i>Castle</i></p><p><i>The Family</i></p><p><i>Galavant</i></p><p><i>The Muppets</i></p><p><i>Rookie Blue</i></p><p><i>The Whispers</i></p><p><i>Nashville</i></p><p><i>Of Kings and Prophets</i></p><p><i>Wicked City</i></p><p><b>CBS</b></p><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"><i>Angel From Hell</i></span></p><p><i>CSI: Cyber</i></p><p><i>Extant</i></p><p><i>The Good Wife</i></p><p><i>Mike and Molly</i></p><p><i>Person of Interest</i></p><p><i>Supergirl </i>(moving to The CW)</p><p><i>Under the Dome</i></p><p><b>Fox</b></p><p><i>American Idol</i></p><p><i>Bordertown</i></p><p><i>Cooper Barrett&apos;s Guide to Surviving Life<br></i></p><p><i>Grandfathered</i></p><p><i>The Grinder</i></p><p><i>Knock Knock Live</i></p><p><b>NBC</b></p><p><i>Hannibal</i></p><p><i>Mr. Robinson</i></p><p><i>Best Time Ever With Neil Patrick Harris</i></p><p><i>Heroes Reborn</i></p><p><b>The CW</b></p><p><i>America&apos;s Next Top Model</i></p><p><i>Beauty and the Beast</i></p><p><i>Containment</i></p><wm:html type="inset" id="1"></wm:html><p><br></p><p>This article originally appeared on www.usmagazine.com: <a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/cbs-cancels-final-csi-series-see-list-of-this-seasons-axed-shows-w206322">CBS Cancels Last Remaining 'CSI' Series: See the Full List of This Season's Axed Network Shows</a></p></content>
	</entry>
	<entry>
		<title>Scandal's Bellamy Young Reveals 'Crazy' Path for Mellie and Kerry Washington's Olivia in Season 5 Finale</title>
		<link rel="alternative" href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/scandals-bellamy-young-crazy-path-for-olivia-mellie-in-season-5-finale-w206301"/>
		<updated>1969-12-31T19:00:00Z</updated>
		<published>2016-05-12T16:22:00Z</published>
		<id>http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/scandals-bellamy-young-crazy-path-for-olivia-mellie-in-season-5-finale-w206301</id>
		<summary type="text">Scandal's Bellamy Young tells Us Weekly Video exclusively about Mellie and Olivia's surprising paths as the ABC drama heads into its season 5 finale on Thursday, May 11 — watch the revealing interview!</summary>
		<content type="html"><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">Enemies become friends!<i> Scandal</i>&apos;s Bellamy Young reveals to Us Weekly Video exclusively what&apos;s in store for her character Mellie Grant&apos;s friendship with Olivia Pope (<b>Kerry Washington</b>) as the ABC series heads into its season 5 finale on Thursday, May 11.</span><br></p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="1"></wm:embed><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">Young, 46, tells Us that the two women putting their differences aside to bond as they work on Mellie&apos;s presidential campaign &#x2014; Mellie, of course, is ex-wife to Fitzgerald Grant (</span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;">Tony Goldwyn</b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">), while Liv is his ex-mistress &#x2014; proves that &quot;life is crazy.&quot;</span><br></p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="2"></wm:embed><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">&quot;We&apos;re both in post-Fitz chapters now, you know?&quot; the</span><i style="line-height: 1.42857;"> Criminal Minds</i><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"> alum says.&#xA0;</span></p><wm:video type="inset" id="1"></wm:video><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">&quot;And out of all of that has really come some healing,&quot; the actress continues. &quot;And to see these two formidable women really come to love and trust each other again and lean on each other, it&apos;s been so much fun to play.&quot;</span><br></p><p></p><wm:media type="photo" id="1"></wm:media><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">After suffering from &quot;debilitating&quot; migraine headaches throughout her career,&#xA0;</span>Young has teamed up with Treximet, a prescription medication used to treat acute migraines.</p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="3"></wm:embed><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">Check out the video above to see Young weigh in on what&apos;s next for Olivia and Fitz, along with her take on the &quot;surreal&quot; similarities between the show&apos;s presidential race and the one playing out in real life.</span><br></p><wm:embed type="related"></wm:embed><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"><i>Scandal</i>&apos;s season 5 finale airs on ABC Thursday, May 11, at 9 p.m. ET.&#xA0;</span><br></p><wm:html type="inset" id="1"></wm:html><p><br></p><p>This article originally appeared on www.usmagazine.com: <a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/scandals-bellamy-young-crazy-path-for-olivia-mellie-in-season-5-finale-w206301">Scandal's Bellamy Young Reveals 'Crazy' Path for Mellie and Kerry Washington's Olivia in Season 5 Finale</a></p></content>
	</entry>
	<entry>
		<title>'Money Monster' Review: George Clooney and Julia Roberts' New Movie Is 'Too Slick for Its Own Good'</title>
		<link rel="alternative" href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/money-monster-gets-25-stars-read-the-review-w206292"/>
		<updated>1969-12-31T19:00:00Z</updated>
		<published>2016-05-12T15:20:46Z</published>
		<id>http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/money-monster-gets-25-stars-read-the-review-w206292</id>
		<summary type="text">George Clooney and Julia Roberts are a dream pairing, but 'Money Monster' doesn't quite add up, writes Us Weekly film critic Mara Reinstein. Read the review!</summary>
		<content type="html"><p></p><p></p><wm:media type="photo" id="1"></wm:media><p></p><p></p><p>2.5 stars (out of 4)<br></p><p> </p><p>Usually when <b><a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrities/george-clooney">George Clooney</a></b> and <b><a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrities/julia-roberts">Julia Roberts</a></b> team up on screen, she helps him pull off an elaborate heist.</p><p> </p><p>The <i>Ocean&#x2019;s</i> franchise is now long gone, and the superstars have reunited. But after watching <i>Money Monster</i>, it&#x2019;s the audience who might want to check its pockets. Despite the dream pairing and the timely topic of a Wall Street meltdown, the mildly entertaining hostage drama doesn&#x2019;t quite add up. The film had its world premiere at the 69th annual Cannes Film Festival on May 12 and opens wide May 13.</p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="1"></wm:embed><p><i style="line-height: 1.42857;">Money Monster</i><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"> is the name of an in-your-face live finance show on a CNBC-type network. It&#x2019;s hosted by a charismatic smart-ass named Lee Gates (Clooney), who uses amusing graphics to make stock predictions and dances like a wild man at Bonnaroo when his picks pan out. Essentially, Clooney is playing a more boorish version of Clooney. (Note: This is most definitely not a problem).</span><br></p><p> </p><p>His latest live show is going exactly as planned, at least as live shows go. The pretty backup dancers have just finished their bit; his unflappable director Patty (Roberts, steady but underused) is in the control room speaking into his earpiece; and a top executive from IBIS, a corporation that just plummeted in the market, is set to appear via satellite. Enter Kyle (<b>Jack O&#x2019;Connell</b>, <i>Unbroken</i>), who storms the set with a gun and threatens to blow Lee&#x2019;s brains out if his message isn&#x2019;t broadcast to the masses.   </p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="2"></wm:embed><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">Kyle made the mistake of listening to Lee&#x2019;s prediction about buying into IBIS. Can you blame the guy? Lee said it was &#x201C;safer than your savings account&#x201D; and Patty agrees to roll the footage as proof. Now Kyle is $60,000 in the hole with a baby on the way. But he&apos;s more steamed about the $800 million that IBIS lost and blamed on a cryptic computer glitch. He&#x2019;s not just mad at the Monster; he&#x2019;s raging at the Machine.</span><br></p><p></p><p></p><wm:media type="photo" id="2"></wm:media><p></p><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"></span></p><p>Though the movie unfolds in real time, it&#x2019;s oddly devoid of tension. No matter how many times Kyle waves his gun in the air and threatens to detonate the place with a bomb, you never truly believe Lee&#x2019;s life is in danger. (Maybe this is because the baby-faced O&#x2019;Connell is as intimidating as a candy striper.) The SWAT team that&#x2019;s plotting outside? Pure window dressing. Sure, that sniper on the rafters could aim and fire after everyone clears the building. He has multiple open shots! But then the film would be 36 minutes long.<br></p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="3"></wm:embed><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">The stakes also seem low. Audiences are watching on TVs all over the world and Lee&#x2019;s impending death plays like just another story in a 24/7 news-cycle universe. A man could get assassinated on live TV and yet it&#x2019;s entirely possible the headline could get bumped tomorrow if </span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;">Beyonce</b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"> drops another surprise album. Consider it the fallout of a popcorn flick too slick and frenetic for its own good. We don&#x2019;t have time to learn about these characters to care about them.</span><br></p><p> </p><p>Besides, Lee is not the bad guy here. Neither is Kyle. That lofty title goes to the head of IBIS (played by <b>Dominic West</b>), who has suspicious (and overly intricate) ties to South Africa. And the ultimate villain is the corrupt banking system. Anyone who turns on cable news knows this is a hot topic of the current political climate; alas, the director can&#x2019;t finesse the point. </p><p> </p><p>The director, by the way, is <b>Jodie Foster</b> &#x2014; an A-lister in her right who has worked with the likes of <b>David Fincher</b> (<i>Panic Room</i>) and <b>Martin Scorsese</b> (<i>Taxi Driver</i>). Given that there is indeed a smart, nail-biting movie in here, it&#x2019;s frustrating that Foster didn&#x2019;t seem to learn much from those auteurs in creating suspense. In her May 13 press conference, Foster noted that her film hit the same notes as &#x2019;70s classics <i>Dog Day Afternoon</i> and <i>Network</i>. But some 40 years from now, <i>Money Monster</i> will likely only be remembered as the film in which Clooney and Roberts took their money &#x2026; and ran to their projects.&#xA0;</p><wm:html type="inset" id="1"></wm:html><p><br></p><p></p><p>This article originally appeared on www.usmagazine.com: <a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/money-monster-gets-25-stars-read-the-review-w206292">'Money Monster' Review: George Clooney and Julia Roberts' New Movie Is 'Too Slick for Its Own Good'</a></p></content>
	</entry>
	<entry>
		<title>Gilmore Girls' Lauren Graham, Scott Patterson Take Selfie on Last Day of Filming </title>
		<link rel="alternative" href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/gilmore-girls-lauren-graham-scott-patterson-take-pic-on-last-day-of-filming-w206306"/>
		<updated>1969-12-31T19:00:00Z</updated>
		<published>2016-05-12T15:20:00Z</published>
		<id>http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/gilmore-girls-lauren-graham-scott-patterson-take-pic-on-last-day-of-filming-w206306</id>
		<summary type="text">Lauren Graham and Scott Patterson took a selfie together after filming their final day on the 'Gilmore Girls' set on Wednesday, May 11 — see the cute photo!</summary>
		<content type="html"><p>These two! <a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrities/lauren-graham"><b>Lauren Graham</b></a> and <a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/gilmore-girls-scott-patterson-team-dean-talks-reunion-see-pics-2015215"><b>Scott Patterson</b></a> made sure to take a selfie together before walking off the <i>Gilmore Girls </i>set on Wednesday, May 11.</p><wm:embed type="inset" id="1"></wm:embed><p>&quot;That&apos;s a wrap! Just hand @thelaurengraham the Emmy now!&quot; Patterson captioned a Twitter photo of the costars on Wednesday. &quot;#GilmoreGirls #Netflix #WarnerBrosTV #whatagreatride!&quot;</p><p>Graham, 49, and Patterson, 57, have been busy working on the Netflix revival since January. Last month, Netflix released a photo of their characters, Lorelai Gilmore and Luke Danes, holding hands. <br></p><p></p><p></p><wm:media type="photo" id="1"></wm:media><p></p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="2"></wm:embed><wm:embed type="related"></wm:embed><p>Back in January, Graham opened up in an interview with<i> <a href="http://tvline.com/2016/01/29/lauren-graham-gilmore-girls-revival-interview-netflix/">TVLine</a></i> about reuniting with her TV daughter <b>Alexis Bledel</b> (Rory Gilmore). &quot;Alexis and I walked onto the set together and &#x2014; I feel super emotional about a lot of it, and I&#x2019;m afraid I&#x2019;m going to start crying at every turn &#x2014; but walking onto that set really felt like something. It felt like a lot of time had passed, and it felt like we were just there. It felt amazing,&quot; she said. <br></p><wm:video type="inset" id="1"></wm:video><p>&quot;Amy [Sherman-Palladino] sent me the scripts, and I gobbled them right up,&quot; she added. &quot;It&apos;s all the positive aspects of running into someone you used to go out with, with none of the downside. It&#x2019;s like, &apos;Hey, old friend! I&#x2019;m happy to see you.&apos;&quot; <br></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="3"></wm:embed><p>A premiere date for the revival has yet to be announced. <br></p><wm:html type="inset" id="1"></wm:html><p><br></p><p>This article originally appeared on www.usmagazine.com: <a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/gilmore-girls-lauren-graham-scott-patterson-take-pic-on-last-day-of-filming-w206306">Gilmore Girls' Lauren Graham, Scott Patterson Take Selfie on Last Day of Filming </a></p></content>
	</entry>
	<entry>
		<title>Bachelorette JoJo Fletcher's Season 12 Suitors Include 'Hipster,' 'Canadian,' 'Bachelor Superfan' </title>
		<link rel="alternative" href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/bachelorette-jojo-fletchers-season-12-suitors-revealed-w206189"/>
		<updated>1969-12-31T19:00:00Z</updated>
		<published>2016-05-12T10:58:00Z</published>
		<id>http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/bachelorette-jojo-fletchers-season-12-suitors-revealed-w206189</id>
		<summary type="text">JoJo Fletcher's suitors for season 12 of 'The Bachelorette' were revealed on Thursday, May 12 — find out their occupations!</summary>
		<content type="html"><p></p><wm:media type="photo" id="1"></wm:media><p></p><p>Oh, it&apos;s on! The suitors vying for <b>JoJo Fletcher&apos;s</b> heart on the upcoming 12th season of <i>The Bachelorette</i> were announced on Thursday, May 12 &#x2014; and they&apos;re an eclectic bunch. <span style="line-height: 1.42857;"></span></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="1"></wm:embed><p>Fletcher&apos;s suitors come from far and wide and range in age from 26 to 34. But it&apos;s their occupations that stick out the most. Some of the jobs listed include &quot;hipster,&quot; &quot;<i>Bachelor</i> superfan&quot; and &quot;Canadian.&quot; </p><p></p><wm:media type="photo" id="2"></wm:media><wm:embed type="inset" id="2"></wm:embed><p><a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/aaron-rodgers-brother-is-a-front-runner-for-bachelorette-jojo-fletcher-w199366">As <i>Us Weekly</i> exclusively revealed in March,</a> <b>Aaron Rodgers</b>&apos; younger brother <b>Jordan</b> is already a favorite on the show. &quot;He and JoJo are really hitting it off,&quot; a show source told <i>Us</i> of the former pro quarterback. &quot;He&#x2019;s a front-runner already.&quot;</p><wm:video type="inset" id="1"></wm:video><p>Fletcher, 25, previously appeared on season 20 of <i>The Bachelor</i> with <b>Ben Higgins</b>. She was left heartbroken in Jamaica when he chose flight attendant <b>Lauren Bushnell </b>over her in the final rose ceremony.</p><wm:embed type="inset" id="3"></wm:embed><p><i>Check out Fletcher&apos;s men below:</i></p><p>Alex, 26, U.S. Marine, Oceanside, California</p><p>Ali, 27, bartender, Santa Monica, California</p><p>Brandon, 28, hipster, Los Angeles, California</p><p>Chad, 28, luxury real estate agent, Tulsa, Oklahoma</p><p>Chase, 27, medical sales representative, Highlands Ranch, Colorado</p><p>Christian, 26, telecom consultant, Los Angeles, California</p><p>Colin &quot;Coley,&quot; 27, real estate consultant, Chicago, Illinois</p><p>Daniel, 31, Canadian, Vancouver, B.C., Canada</p><p>Derek, 29, commercial banker, Ft. Lauderdale, Florida</p><p>Evan, 33, erectile dysfunction specialist, Nashville, Tennessee</p><p>Grant, 28, firefighter, San Francisco, California</p><p>Jake, 26, landscape architect, Playa Vista, California</p><p>James F., 34, boxing club owner, Nashville, Tennessee</p><p>James S., 27, <i>Bachelor</i> superfan, Phoenix, Arizona</p><wm:video type="inset" id="2"></wm:video><p>James Taylor, 29, singer-songwriter, Katy, Texas</p><p>Jonathan, 29, technical sales representative, Vancouver, B.C., Canada</p><p>Jordan, 27, former pro quarterback, Chico, California</p><p>Luke, 31, war veteran, Burnet, Texas</p><p>Nick B., 33, electrical engineer, Fort Lauderdale, Florida</p><p>Nick S., 26, software salesman, San Francisco, California</p><p>Peter, 26, staffing agency manager, Chicago, Illinois</p><wm:embed type="related"></wm:embed><p>Robert &#x201C;Robby,&#x201D; 27, former competitive swimmer, Jacksonville, Florida</p><p>Sal, 28, operations manager, Fort Lauderdale, Florida</p><p>Vincent &#x201C;Vinny,&#x201D; 28, barber, Delray Beach, Florida</p><p>Wells, 31, radio DJ, Nashville, Tennessee</p><p>William &#x201C;Will,&#x201D; 26, civil engineer, Jersey City, New Jersey</p><p><i>The Bachelorette</i> returns on ABC on Monday, May 30 at 8 p.m. ET.</p><p><i>Tell </i>Us<i>: What do you think about Fletcher&apos;s contestants? <br></i></p><wm:html type="inset" id="1"></wm:html><p><br></p><p>This article originally appeared on www.usmagazine.com: <a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/bachelorette-jojo-fletchers-season-12-suitors-revealed-w206189">Bachelorette JoJo Fletcher's Season 12 Suitors Include 'Hipster,' 'Canadian,' 'Bachelor Superfan' </a></p></content>
	</entry>
	<entry>
		<title>Sheryl Crow Covers Country Living's Music Issue: See Her Nashville Home!</title>
		<link rel="alternative" href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/sheryl-crow-covers-country-livings-music-issue-at-nashville-home-w206173"/>
		<updated>1969-12-31T19:00:00Z</updated>
		<published>2016-05-12T09:45:00Z</published>
		<id>http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/sheryl-crow-covers-country-livings-music-issue-at-nashville-home-w206173</id>
		<summary type="text">Sheryl Crow shares a look at her 50-acre Nashville home in Country Living's June issue — see the stunning pics!</summary>
		<content type="html"><wm:media type="photo" id="1"></wm:media><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">Soaking up the sun in her gorgeous home! <b>Sheryl Crow</b> graces the cover of <i>Country Living</i>&apos;s June music&#x2013;themed issue along with her adorable rescue dog, Benji, and shares an exclusive peek at her 50-acre Nashville estate.</span><br></p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="1"></wm:embed><p>In the magazine&apos;s cover story, the &quot;All I Wanna Do&quot; singer, 54, chats about her move to Music City USA from Los Angeles, where she lived for 20 years. &quot;When I bought this property,&quot; Crow told the magazine, &quot;I thought it would be nice to have a space that has nothing to do with work &#x2014; just a quiet and sacred space to gather.&quot;</p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="2"></wm:embed><p>But things didn&apos;t turn out exactly as she had envisioned. The charming barn on the property &#x2014; which also includes her house and a church &#x2014; eventually became a soundproofed recording studio. &quot;It&#x2019;s ideal because I&#x2019;m a single mom,&quot; says Crow, who has sons Wyatt, 9, and Levi, 6, adopted in 2007 and 2010 respectively. &quot;I can go to work just down the driveway.&quot;</p><p></p><wm:media type="photo" id="2"></wm:media><p>The nine-time Grammy winner &#x2014; whose 1996 hit &quot;If It Makes You Happy&quot; went platinum &#x2014; recorded her debut country album, 2013&apos;s <i>Feels Like Home</i>, and 2010&apos;s <i>100 Miles From Memphis</i> in her Nashville studio, where guitars line the walls.&#xA0;<span style="line-height: 1.42857;">One instrument, lovingly dubbed the &quot;moneymaker,&quot; was used to write every hit of her career!</span></p><p></p><wm:media type="photo" id="3"></wm:media><p><i>Country Livin</i>g&apos;s second annual music&#x2013;centric issue hits newsstands Tuesday, May 17, and also features <b>Carrie Underwood</b>&apos;s favorite country furniture (rocking chairs and porch swings!), <b>Trisha Yearwood</b>&apos;s recipe for a prized apple pie and <b>Kacey Musgraves</b>&apos; <i>Alice in Wonderland</i>&#x2013;inspired backyard birthday tea party.<br></p><wm:html type="inset" id="1"></wm:html><p><br></p><p></p><p>This article originally appeared on www.usmagazine.com: <a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/sheryl-crow-covers-country-livings-music-issue-at-nashville-home-w206173">Sheryl Crow Covers Country Living's Music Issue: See Her Nashville Home!</a></p></content>
	</entry>
	<entry>
		<title>Gwen Stefani, Blake Shelton Grab Double Date Selfie with Adam Levine, Behati Prinsloo </title>
		<link rel="alternative" href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/gwen-stefani-blake-shelton-double-date-with-adam-behati-w206178"/>
		<updated>1969-12-31T19:00:00Z</updated>
		<published>2016-05-12T07:50:00Z</published>
		<id>http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/gwen-stefani-blake-shelton-double-date-with-adam-behati-w206178</id>
		<summary type="text">Gwen Stefani and Blake Shelton cuddled up for an adorable selfie with fellow celebrity couple Adam Levine and Behati Prinsloo — see it here</summary>
		<content type="html"><p>Double dating goals! <b><a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrities/gwen-stefani">Gwen Stefani</a></b> and <b><a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrities/blake-shelton">Blake Shelton</a></b> cozied up with their <i>Voice</i> costar <b><a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrities/adam-levine">Adam Levine </a></b>and his pregnant wife,&#xA0;<b>Behati Prinsloo,</b> for a totally adorable selfie on Wednesday, May 11. </p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="1"></wm:embed><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">The gorgeous lovebirds were evidently having a riot as they goofed around in the photograph, Levine opening his mouth wide while Stefani, Shelton and Prinsloo all grinned from ear to ear.</span><br></p><wm:html type="inset" id="1"></wm:html><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">The picture was taken backstage at </span><i style="line-height: 1.42857;">The Voice</i><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">, where Stefani, 46, and her boyfriend, Shelton, 39, had just performed the </span><a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/gwen-stefani-blake-shelton-debut-duet-on-the-voice-watch-w205867" style="line-height: 1.42857; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">debut performance of their duet</a><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">, &quot;Go Ahead and Break My Heart.&quot;</span><br></p><wm:embed type="related"></wm:embed><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">The duo&apos;s performance was totally mesmerizing, and displayed how crazy the pair are about each other, as they gazed deep into each other&#x2019;s eyes throughout the song.</span></p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="2"></wm:embed><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">But they&apos;re not the only ones enjoying some exciting couple time together at the moment. Prinsloo, 26, and Levine, 37, are expecting their first baby, and the excited dad-to-be recently revealed that their little bundle of joy will be a girl.</span><br></p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="3"></wm:embed><wm:video type="inset" id="1"></wm:video><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">&#x201C;I&#x2019;m about to be a dad. I&#x2019;m super pumped,&#x201D; the Maroon 5 frontman told </span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;">Kelly Ripa</b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"> and </span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;">Michael Strahan</b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"> last month.  &#x201C;I&#x2019;m having a girl,&#x201D; he proudly said with a smile on his face.</span><br></p><wm:html type="inset" id="2"></wm:html><p><br></p><p><br></p><p>This article originally appeared on www.usmagazine.com: <a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/gwen-stefani-blake-shelton-double-date-with-adam-behati-w206178">Gwen Stefani, Blake Shelton Grab Double Date Selfie with Adam Levine, Behati Prinsloo </a></p></content>
	</entry>
	<entry>
		<title>'The Real Housewives of New York City' Recap: Dorinda Medley Calls Ramona Singer a 'Bitch,' Carole Radziwill Insults Jules Wainstein's Weight</title>
		<link rel="alternative" href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/rhony-carole-radziwill-insults-jules-wainsteins-weight-w206051"/>
		<updated>1969-12-31T19:00:00Z</updated>
		<published>2016-05-11T22:55:00Z</published>
		<id>http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/rhony-carole-radziwill-insults-jules-wainsteins-weight-w206051</id>
		<summary type="text">In The Real Housewives of New York City's Wednesday, May 11, episode, Dorinda Medley and Ramona Singer fought about John (again), while Carole Radziwill weighed in on Jules Wainstein's size — read Us Weekly's recap</summary>
		<content type="html"><div><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">Go big or go home, especially in New York City. On the Wednesday, May 11, episode of </span><i style="line-height: 1.42857;">The Real Housewives of New York City</i><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">, the ladies found themselves swirling in a tornado of drama. From psychic readings that sparked waterworks, to birthday parties where tempers soared, it seemed that every event was an opportunity to accuse someone of having an eating disorder or a drinking problem or a boyfriend who&apos;s subpar.</span><br></div><p><b>It&apos;s Written in the Stars ... or Something</b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"><br></span></p><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">Thinking it would be a fun bonding activity,</span><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">&#xA0;</span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;"><a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrities/carole-radziwill">Carole Radziwill</a></b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"> hosted a little get-together for some of the girls to get readings from </span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;">Kim Russo</b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">, a psychic medium. </span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;">Dorinda Medley</b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">, </span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;">Jules Wainstein</b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">, </span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;"><a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrities/bethenny-frankel">Bethenny Frankel</a></b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">&#xA0;and </span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;">Ramona Singer</b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"> all dropped by for the occasion, though some were more open to the spirit world than others. (Ramona clearly bought every word, while Bethenny could barely hide her annoyance at the whole concept.)</span></p><div><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="1"></wm:embed><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">After fawning all over Jules about how she is setting out to be an example to women everywhere, the psychic turned to Bethenny, noting that the Skinnygirl creator was &quot;blocking&quot; her. Before Bethenny could argue, Kim said that Bethenny&apos;s father &quot;doesn&apos;t connect with his heart,&quot; which didn&#x2019;t impress Bethenny much. The psychic then informed Bethenny that she didn&apos;t see Bethenny getting married again, and Bethenny said she needed to go pick up her daughter from school.</span></p><p>Turning to Dorinda, Kim broke the news that she wouldn&#x2019;t be marrying her boyfriend, <b>John Mahdessian</b>, prompting Ramona to blurt out, &quot;Thank God.&quot;&#xA0;</p><p>Dorinda was not happy about that. &quot;John doesn&apos;t like you either. He thinks you&apos;re a bitch,&quot; she snapped. While Ramona tried to backpedal in her special Ramona way, Dorinda went on a rampage, ordering her friend to &quot;stop acting like a bitch.&quot; Ramona, clearly startled, told Dorinda she was getting out of control (which, to be fair, she sort of was). &quot;Shut your mouth!&quot; Dorinda screamed. &quot;No one gives a s--t!&quot; </p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="2"></wm:embed><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">Carole noted she was &quot;embarrassed&quot; by the situation as Dorinda declared that </span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;">Mario</b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"> left Ramona for someone else. When Ramona tried to correct Dorinda, she shouted, &quot;Shut up! I&apos;m tired of it, and I&apos;m not putting up with it anymore!&quot;</span><br></p><p>Somehow Kim defused the situation enough to talk to Ramona about her late father, which quickly brought the normally bubbly blonde to tears. Seemingly touched, Dorinda snuggled up next to Ramona and they made up. Again. For now. </p><p><b>Dorinda Tells John to Grab an Easy Pass Back to Queens</b></p><p>After the psychic reading, Dorinda headed out on a dinner date with the man of the hour: her boyfriend, John. Though things started nicely enough, Dorinda&apos;s mood quickly turned as John insisted, repeatedly, that in his ongoing war with Ramona, he was not in any way at fault. &quot;I&apos;ve been a gentleman,&quot; he repeated over and over as Dorinda became more and more agitated. </p><p>&quot;Oh, my God!&quot; she finally snapped. &quot;It&apos;s not about you! I don&apos;t want to talk about you!&quot; John then dramatically stabbed a fork into his meal to indicate the conversation was over. </p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="3"></wm:embed><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">&quot;Do it again, and grab an Easy Pass to Queens,&quot; Dorinda said before storming out. (To be clear, grabbing &quot;an Easy Pass to Queens&quot; was an insult.) &quot;John is not understanding that I&apos;m sick and tired,&quot; she lamented to the camera. &quot;And he&apos;s part of the reason that I&apos;m done.&quot;</span><br></p><p><b>Jules Opens Up to Carole About Her Eating Disorder</b></p><p>Meanwhile, Jules and Carole got together to debrief about the fight between Ramona and Dorinda at the psychic party &#x2014; but they ended up talking about Jules instead. After Carole asked Jules what the psychic meant when she said that Jules was striving to be a role model for women, Jules first cited being a mother. Unsatisfied, Carole pushed on saying she thought the psychic meant &quot;something bigger.&quot; Finally, Jules opened up about the real reason she hoped to be a role model. </p><p>&quot;I&apos;m over 12 years in recovery for an eating disorder,&quot; she said proudly. While Carole was supportive in the moment, to the camera she admitted she &quot;wasn&#x2019;t surprised&quot; Jules had an eating disorder because she is &quot;very, very, very thin &#x2014; unnaturally thin.&quot; She also noted that Jules seemed to &quot;care a lot about food&quot; and &quot;puts a lot of food out when guests come over.&quot; Carole shrugged and said, &quot;She definitely has a relationship with food.&quot; (In other words, Carole didn&apos;t seem convinced the eating disorder was behind Jules at all.)</p><p><b>It&apos;s Sonja&apos;s Party, and She&apos;ll Drink Prosecco If She Wants to (And She Wants to)</b></p><p>After getting a bizarre (and possibly illegal) facial, Sonja was ready to celebrate her birthday in style. Pretty much everyone made it out for the big soiree except Bethenny, which was probably for the best &#x2014; but more on that later. </p><p>Tensions were high between Ramona and <b>Luann de Lesseps</b> from the start, as Luann confronted Ramona about telling Sonja that she was concerned about the Countess spending time with her. &quot;Me? A bad influence on Sonja?&quot; Luann gasped. &quot;Are you kidding me, Mrs. Turtle Time?&quot; She then accused Ramona of going around &quot;with a bottle of pinot grigio&quot; up her skirt.</p><p></p><wm:media type="photo" id="1"></wm:media><p>&quot;I&apos;m not like Luann and Sonja, who stay out until 4 in the morning and then bring whatever guys they meet back to the place and drink, and who knows else they do,&quot; Ramona quipped to the camera. She went on to argue, &quot;It&apos;s not a good fit because Luann likes to drink a lot, and Sonja can&apos;t keep up with her. We&apos;re supposed to take Sonja away from drinking, taking her away from being with random men, and all Luann does is add to the influence of both.&quot;</p><p>At some point during Luann and Ramona&apos;s conversation, Sonja butted in to say, &quot;You guys have nothing better to do than talk about me!&quot; She didn&apos;t seem the least bit concerned about anything they were saying, however. (Oh, they also got into it about Luann &quot;re-gifting&quot; a necklace to Ramona. The biggest takeaway from that, however, was that Ramona doesn&apos;t know what re-gifting is because it didn&apos;t sound like that&apos;s what Luann had done.)</p><p>In any case, the party ended with Sonja revealing her latest business venture, a prosecco called Tipsy Girl. &quot;Booze. That&apos;s the last thing Sonja needs to do,&quot; Ramona said to the camera before commenting that the name was awfully similar to Bethenny&apos;s brand, Skinnygirl. </p><p>For her part, Sonja was (or was pretending to be) oblivious to the similarity between her liquor brand and Bethenny&apos;s. &quot;I love the name Tipsy Girl, and I feel like I&apos;m the ultimate Tipsy Girl!&quot; she declared with a smile. &quot;I really wish Bethenny were here because I&apos;d really like to get her opinion.&quot;</p><p>While Jules seemed to anticipate that the name might be an issue for Bethenny, Dorinda disagreed. &quot;I can&apos;t imagine this is going to matter to Bethenny,&quot; Dorinda reasoned. &quot;Bethenny is an ocean, and this is a tiny stream.&quot;</p><p>Tell <i>Us</i>: Was Carole right to be concerned about Jules&apos; weight, or did her remarks go too far?</p><p><i>The Real Housewives of New York City </i>airs on Bravo Wednesdays at 9 p.m. ET.&#xA0;</p><wm:html type="inset" id="1"></wm:html><p><br></p>            </div><p>This article originally appeared on www.usmagazine.com: <a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/rhony-carole-radziwill-insults-jules-wainsteins-weight-w206051">'The Real Housewives of New York City' Recap: Dorinda Medley Calls Ramona Singer a 'Bitch,' Carole Radziwill Insults Jules Wainstein's Weight</a></p></content>
	</entry>
	<entry>
		<title>John Cho Stars In Every Blockbuster Movie In Viral Internet Meme</title>
		<link rel="alternative" href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/john-cho-stars-in-every-movie-in-viral-internet-meme-w206174"/>
		<updated>1969-12-31T19:00:00Z</updated>
		<published>2016-05-11T22:42:00Z</published>
		<id>http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/john-cho-stars-in-every-movie-in-viral-internet-meme-w206174</id>
		<summary type="text">John Cho is the star of every new blockbuster thanks to a viral new campaign against whitewashing in Hollywood — get the details</summary>
		<content type="html"><wm:media type="photo" id="1"></wm:media><p>First it was a <i>Doctor Strange</i> trailer with<b> Tilda Swinton </b>playing the Tibetan Ancient One. Then it was a photo of<b> Scarlett Johansson</b> as Japanese cyborg Motoko Kusnagi in <i>Ghost in the Shell</i>. Add to that, the first-look images of <b>Elizabeth Banks</b> as the originally Asian character Rita Repulsa in 2017&#x2019;s <i>Power Rangers</i> remake. All those reveals in the last month had one thing in common: Caucasians cast in Asian roles.</p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="1"></wm:embed><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">In response, New York-based digital strategist </span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;">William Yu</b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"> launched a viral campaign with the hashtag #StarringJohnCho on Thursday, May 5, featuring&#xA0;</span><i style="line-height: 1.42857;">Star Trek</i><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"> actor </span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;"><a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrities/john-cho">John Cho</a></b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"> Photoshopped onto the posters of </span><i style="line-height: 1.42857;">The Nice Guys</i><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">, </span><i style="line-height: 1.42857;">Spectre</i><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">, </span><i style="line-height: 1.42857;">Me Before You</i><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">, </span><i style="line-height: 1.42857;">Mother&#x2019;s Day</i><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">, </span><i style="line-height: 1.42857;">Jurassic World</i><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"> and </span><i style="line-height: 1.42857;">Avengers: Age of Ultron</i><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">.</span><br></p><p>&#x201C;Opposition to an Asian-American playing the lead of a major motion picture is an unfounded and antiquated notion,&#x201D; 25-year-old Yu tells <i>Us Weekly</i>. &#x201C;With #OscarsSoWhite and then with the slew of recent white-washing of Asian roles, it became clear that now was the time to do something.&#x201D;</p><wm:html type="inset" id="1"></wm:html><p>How did Yu land on using the 43-year-old Korean-American actor as the face of his campaign? &quot;I wanted focus on someone who not only has the artistic chops, but also the financial backing,&#x201D; Yu tells <i>Us</i>. &quot;Cho has received critical praise &#x2026; while also bringing in over $100,000,000 as the face of the Harold &amp; Kumar franchise. [He also] possesses the unique combination of charisma, presence and bankable talent that a leading man requires.&#x201D;</p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="2"></wm:embed><p></p><wm:media type="photo" id="2"></wm:media><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">So far, <a href="https://twitter.com/JohnTheCho/status/729832143837233152">Cho&#x2019;s only response</a> has been a red heart emoji to Yu&#x2019;s @StarringJohnCho Twitter account. But the digital strategist&#x2019;s goal &#x201C;to spark a discussion and challenge the ways in which Asian-Americans are perceived in popular culture&#x201D; is happening, thanks to responses from stars including </span><i style="line-height: 1.42857;">Fresh Off the Boat</i><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">&#x2019;s </span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;">Constance Wu</b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">.</span><br></p><wm:html type="inset" id="2"></wm:html><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">This meme follows last week&#x2019;s #WhiteWashedOut campaign, led by comedian </span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;">Margaret Cho</b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"> and</span><i style="line-height: 1.42857;"> The Prophecy</i><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"> series author </span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;">Ellen Oh</b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"> to call Hollywood out on the recent whitewashed casting. </span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;">Kerry Washington</b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"> and </span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;">Johnathon Schaech</b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"> have also shared the hashtag in solidarity.&#xA0;</span><br></p><wm:html type="inset" id="3"></wm:html><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">Also last week, the tag #MyYellowFaceStory launched, encouraging Asian-Americans, especially in theater, to share their stories of inequality behind the scenes. While Tony winner</span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;"> Lea Salonga </b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">shared <a href="https://twitter.com/MsLeaSalonga/status/725859587442626560">bias she experienced</a> while attempting to audition for a Broadway role, </span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;">Katie Leung</b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">, who played Cho Chang in the </span><i style="line-height: 1.42857;">Harry Potter</i><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"> film series, posted a photo of a collectible Potter card, where a photo of another Asian actress was used.</span><br></p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="3"></wm:embed><wm:html type="inset" id="4"></wm:html><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">This trio of hashtags continues the conversations that have long been a part of diversity in the media, as</span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;"> Ming-Na Wen </b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">and </span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;">George Takei</b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">, among others, have voiced.</span><br></p><wm:html type="inset" id="5"></wm:html><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">As Yu&#x2019;s visual meme continues to travel through the internet, he hopes it will get the attention of those who can make an impact. &quot;It&apos;s been great seeing those in the film industry support the movement,&#x201D; he tells Us. &quot;#StarringJohnCho demonstrates the desire for an Asian-American lead, now Hollywood execs just have to see it &#x2026; and take note.&quot;</span><br></p><wm:html type="inset" id="6"></wm:html><p><br></p><p>This article originally appeared on www.usmagazine.com: <a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/john-cho-stars-in-every-movie-in-viral-internet-meme-w206174">John Cho Stars In Every Blockbuster Movie In Viral Internet Meme</a></p></content>
	</entry>
	<entry>
		<title>Justin Timberlake, Anna Kendrick Perform Emotional Duet of ‘True Colors’ at Cannes</title>
		<link rel="alternative" href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/justin-timberlake-anna-kendrick-perform-true-colors-w206172"/>
		<updated>1969-12-31T19:00:00Z</updated>
		<published>2016-05-11T21:33:00Z</published>
		<id>http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/justin-timberlake-anna-kendrick-perform-true-colors-w206172</id>
		<summary type="text">‘Trolls’ costars Justin Timberlake and Anna Kendrick performed a touching rendition of Cyndi Lauper’s ‘True Colors’ at the 2016 Cannes Film Festival on Wednesday, May 11 — watch </summary>
		<content type="html"><p>#Feels. <i>Trolls </i>costars <b>Justin Timberlake </b>and <b>Anna Kendrick </b>serenaded the crowd at the 2016 Cannes Film Festival on Wednesday, May 11, with an emotional rendition of <b>Cyndi Lauper</b>&#x2019;s hit song &#x201C;True Colors,&#x201D; a standard in the gay community.</p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="1"></wm:embed><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">&quot;We are Anna and Garfunkel,&#x201D; Timberlake, 35, joked while introducing themselves to the crowd. &quot;OK, we are going to give this a go, but you guys have to be nice.&quot;</span><br></p><p>Kendrick, who was nominated for her first Tony Award when she was just 12 in 1998, added: &quot;We&apos;re just friends here right? This isn&apos;t like a big deal &#x2026; we&apos;re just hanging out in our living room.&quot;</p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="2"></wm:embed><p></p><wm:media type="photo" id="1"></wm:media><p>The two, of course, totally nailed their chill-inducing acoustic performance. </p><p>The <i>Trolls </i>soundtrack marks Timberlake&#x2019;s return to music. The former &apos;NSync member released his latest single &quot;Can&apos;t Stop the Feeling&#x201D; on Friday, May 6. </p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="3"></wm:embed><p><i style="line-height: 1.42857;">Trolls&#xA0;</i><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">revolves around the little creatures embarking on a journey that takes them far beyond the only world they&apos;ve ever known and also features Gwen Stefani, James Corden, Russell Brand, Jeffrey Tambor and Christine Barankski.</span><br></p><p><i>Trolls</i> hits theaters November 4. &#xA0;</p><p><b><i><a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/services/newsletter/signup?utm_source=usmagazine&amp;utm_medium=website&amp;utm_campaign=newsletterpromo1">Sign up now for the </a></i><a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/services/newsletter/signup?utm_source=usmagazine&amp;utm_medium=website&amp;utm_campaign=newsletterpromo1">Us Weekly</a><i><a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/services/newsletter/signup?utm_source=usmagazine&amp;utm_medium=website&amp;utm_campaign=newsletterpromo1"> newsletter</a> to get breaking celebrity news, hot pics and more delivered straight to your inbox!</i></b></p><p>This article originally appeared on www.usmagazine.com: <a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/justin-timberlake-anna-kendrick-perform-true-colors-w206172">Justin Timberlake, Anna Kendrick Perform Emotional Duet of ‘True Colors’ at Cannes</a></p></content>
	</entry>
	<entry>
		<title>My 600-Lb Life's Laura Perez Says Her Husband Joey Is 'Jealous' She Lost 300 Pounds: Watch the Sneak Peek</title>
		<link rel="alternative" href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/my-600-lb-lifes-laura-says-husband-is-jealous-she-lost-300-pounds-w206170"/>
		<updated>1969-12-31T19:00:00Z</updated>
		<published>2016-05-11T21:06:00Z</published>
		<id>http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/my-600-lb-lifes-laura-says-husband-is-jealous-she-lost-300-pounds-w206170</id>
		<summary type="text">'My 600-Lb Life' subject Laura Perez reveals that her weight loss has created tension with partner Joey in the show's Wednesday May 11, episode — watch Us Weekly's exclusive first look</summary>
		<content type="html"><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">Ready to make a splash. <b>Laura Perez</b> heads to water aerobics in her quest to lose 80 more pounds in <i>My 600-lb Life</i>&apos;s Wednesday, May 11, episode, as seen in <i>Us Weekly</i>&apos;s exclusive sneak peek.</span><br></p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="1"></wm:embed><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">The TLC series&apos; preview clip catches up with Perez, 42, who once weighed in at close to 600 pounds and now is 260 pounds. She hopes to lose a bit more weight in order to qualify for skin surgery.</span><br></p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="2"></wm:embed><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">Sadly, her progress has created tension with common-law husband </span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;">Joey</b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">, who got used to assisting Laura when she was heavier.</span><br></p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="3"></wm:embed><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">&quot;Joey gets jealous that I can do things on my own, so he wants to come along to see what I&apos;m up to,&quot; she says of him joining her for day-to-day activities.&#xA0;</span><br></p><p></p><p></p><wm:media type="photo" id="1"></wm:media><p></p><p></p><p>&quot;He&apos;s always trying to take care of me, even when I don&apos;t need the help,&quot; Laura continues. &quot;That will cause us to argue because I still want to live my own life and not feel like I&apos;m 600 pounds.&quot;</p><p>Watch her discuss her weight-loss goals in the video above.</p><p><i>My 600-lb Life</i> airs on TLC Wednesdays at 9 p.m. ET.&#xA0;</p><wm:html type="inset" id="1"></wm:html><p><br></p><p>This article originally appeared on www.usmagazine.com: <a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/my-600-lb-lifes-laura-says-husband-is-jealous-she-lost-300-pounds-w206170">My 600-Lb Life's Laura Perez Says Her Husband Joey Is 'Jealous' She Lost 300 Pounds: Watch the Sneak Peek</a></p></content>
	</entry>
	<entry>
		<title>Wendy Williams: Why Katy Perry Should Give Orlando Bloom 'His Walking Papers' </title>
		<link rel="alternative" href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/wendy-williams-katy-perry-should-give-orlando-bloom-his-walking-papers-w206117"/>
		<updated>1969-12-31T19:00:00Z</updated>
		<published>2016-05-11T16:20:00Z</published>
		<id>http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/wendy-williams-katy-perry-should-give-orlando-bloom-his-walking-papers-w206117</id>
		<summary type="text">Wendy Williams thinks that Katy Perry should dump Orlando Bloom after the actor was spotted getting close to Selena Gomez in Las Vegas — watch the video!</summary>
		<content type="html"><p>Bye-bye, Bloom! <b>Wendy Williams </b>wants<b> Katy Perry </b>to kick <a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrities/orlando-bloom"><b>Orlando Bloom</b></a> to the curb &#x2014; and stat! During her daytime talk show on Wednesday, May 11, the TV personality gabbed about Bloom recently getting cozy in Las Vegas with <a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrities/selena-gomez"><b>Selena Gomez</b></a>.</p><wm:embed type="inset" id="1"></wm:embed><p>&quot;Katy Perry, leave him alone. We don&apos;t need the headache. The speculation is out there, your boyfriend Orlando Bloom was caught with another woman,&quot; Williams, 51, said. &quot;I don&#x2019;t think he even cares about having a relationship with Selena, she&#x2019;s just a comfort zone. I don&#x2019;t even need the receipts of whether they slept together that night, he&#x2019;s neck-nuzzling. Katy, give him his walking papers, he&#x2019;s done.&quot;</p><p></p><p></p><wm:media type="photo" id="1"></wm:media><p></p><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">Bloom, 39, and Perry, 31, have been dating since they </span><a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/katy-perry-orlando-bloom-flirt-at-golden-globes-2016-party-w161304" style="line-height: 1.42857; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">hit it off at the Golden Globe Awards</a><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"> back in January. On Tuesday, </span><a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/selena-gomez-orlando-bloom-get-close-in-vegas-report-w205943" style="line-height: 1.42857; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"><i>TMZ</i> posted photos of Bloom</a><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"> getting close with Gomez, 23, inside Las Vegas&#x2019; Mandalay Bay Resort and Casino on May 7.<i> </i>The site</span><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"> reports that they didn&apos;t spend the night together.&#xA0;</span><br></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="2"></wm:embed><wm:embed type="related"></wm:embed><p>&quot;Selena was just trying to have a good time with friends, but Orlando was all over her,&quot; an onlooker told <i>Us Weekly</i>. <br></p><p>Gomez and the <i>Romans</i> actor have history. In April 2014, they were <a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/selena-gomez-orlando-bloom-hang-out-at-chelsea-handlers-show-2014284">photographed sitting on a curb</a> together outside <b>Chelsea Handler</b>&apos;s stand-up comedy show in L.A. <br></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="3"></wm:embed><p>Gomez&apos;s ex <b>Justin Bieber</b> also has been connected to Bloom. Back in 2012, Bieber was spotted flirting with Bloom&apos;s <a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/miranda-kerr-orlando-bloom-split-after-three-years-of-marriage-20132510">ex-wife, <b>Miranda Kerr</b>,</a> at a Victoria&apos;s Secret fashion show. In July 2014, the men <a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/orlando-bloom-takes-a-swipe-at-justin-bieber-in-ibiza-2014307">reportedly had an altercation</a> at Ibiza&apos;s Cipriani nightspot.</p><wm:html type="inset" id="1"></wm:html><p><br></p><p>This article originally appeared on www.usmagazine.com: <a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/wendy-williams-katy-perry-should-give-orlando-bloom-his-walking-papers-w206117">Wendy Williams: Why Katy Perry Should Give Orlando Bloom 'His Walking Papers' </a></p></content>
	</entry>
	<entry>
		<title>Khloe and Kim Kardashian Call It a ‘Miracle’ That Blac Chyna Got Rob Out of His Shell</title>
		<link rel="alternative" href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/khloe-kim-kardashian-call-rob-and-blac-chyna-a-miracle-w206116"/>
		<updated>1969-12-31T19:00:00Z</updated>
		<published>2016-05-11T16:15:00Z</published>
		<id>http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/khloe-kim-kardashian-call-rob-and-blac-chyna-a-miracle-w206116</id>
		<summary type="text">Khloe and Kim Kardashian call Rob’s romance with Blac Chyna a ‘miracle’ in a preview for the next episode of ‘Keeping Up With the Kardashians’ — watch</summary>
		<content type="html"><wm:embed type="related"></wm:embed><p>Miracles happen! <b>Khlo&#xE9;</b> and <b>Kim Kardashian</b> are crediting <b>Blac Chyna</b> with helping their younger brother, <b>Rob</b>, let go of his formerly reclusive lifestyle, a preview for the Sunday, May 15, episode of <i>Keeping Up With the Kardashians</i> reveals.<br></p><p>&quot;Question,&quot; Khlo&#xE9;, 31, tells Kim in the sneak peek above. &#x201C;Like, don&apos;t we kind of think it&apos;s a miracle that Rob, who doesn&apos;t even show up to Christmas for the past three years, literally he wouldn&apos;t leave his room, but the fact that now he&apos;s created a Snapchat, the fact that now he wants to be so public, blows my mind.&quot;</p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="1"></wm:embed><p>The <i>Selfish</i> author, 35, agrees. &quot;She gave him confidence, more power to her,&quot; Kim says. &quot;After Rob and Blac Chyna started dating, Rob is now, like, all over social media and, like, out and about.&#x201D;<br></p><p></p><wm:media type="photo" id="1"></wm:media><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">Although Kim says that Chyna&#x2019;s romance with Rob has ruffled the Kardashian-Jenner clan&#x2019;s feathers, the mom of North, 2, and Saint, 5 months, admits that the sole male Kardashian seems better than ever since finding love with the video model-turned-makeup maven.</span><br></p><p> </p><p>&#x201C;He hasn&apos;t been like this in so long that even though there&apos;s been some drama,&#x201D; she adds of her Arthur George sock designer sibling. &#x201C;If this is what it takes, then I don&apos;t care who he&apos;s dating. I&apos;m just so happy that he&apos;s feeling better about himself.&quot;</p><p></p><wm:media type="photo" id="2"></wm:media><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">Chyna, 28, is mom to son King Cairo, 3, who she shares with ex-fiance <b>Tyga</b>. The &#x201C;Rack City&#x201D; rapper is now dating Rob&#x2019;s younger half-sister,&#xA0;</span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;">Kylie Jenner</b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">.</span><br></p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="2"></wm:embed><p>Despite a complicated dynamic, Khlo&#xE9; concedes that Chyna &#x2014; who has helped Rob shed almost 70 pounds since they got together back in January &#x2014; has been a blessing for her bro. &quot;If some p--sy is getting him to remove his braces and shave his beard and work out...,&#x201D; the former <i>Kocktails With Khlo&#xE9;</i> host quips.<br></p><p> </p><p>As <i>Us Weekly </i>previously reported, Kim accompanied Rob and Chyna to a doctor&#x2019;s appointment and to brunch at Nate&#x2019;n Al of Beverly Hills on Tuesday, April 26. This outing marked the first time Rob had been spotted out in public with his older sibling since he bailed on attending her 2014 wedding to <b>Kanye West</b>.</p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="3"></wm:embed><p>&#x201C;Kim&apos;s always been the peacemaker,&#x201D; a source told <i>Us</i> about the reality-TV superstar&#x2019;s effort to smooth things over with the once-controversial couple.<br></p><p> </p><p>Rob asked for Chyna&#x2019;s hand in marriage with a stunning 7-carat diamond ring designed by celebrity jeweler <b>Ben Baller</b>. On Friday, May 6, Chyna announced that she is pregnant and expecting her first child with the E! personality. </p><p> </p><p>Watch the video above. <i>Keeping Up With the Kardashians</i> airs on E! Sundays at 9 p.m. ET.</p><wm:html type="inset" id="1"></wm:html><p><br></p><p></p><p>This article originally appeared on www.usmagazine.com: <a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/khloe-kim-kardashian-call-rob-and-blac-chyna-a-miracle-w206116">Khloe and Kim Kardashian Call It a ‘Miracle’ That Blac Chyna Got Rob Out of His Shell</a></p></content>
	</entry>
	<entry>
		<title>Aaron Carter Opens Up About Being $150K in Debt on ‘Life Or Debt’</title>
		<link rel="alternative" href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/aaron-carter-opens-up-about-being-150k-in-debt-w206091"/>
		<updated>1969-12-31T19:00:00Z</updated>
		<published>2016-05-11T15:28:00Z</published>
		<id>http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/aaron-carter-opens-up-about-being-150k-in-debt-w206091</id>
		<summary type="text">In a preview for the Sunday, May 15, episode of Spike’s ‘Life or Debt,’ Aaron Carter opens up about being $150K in debt — watch the clip</summary>
		<content type="html"><wm:embed type="related"></wm:embed><p>Aaron, oh Aaron, what are you going to do?<br></p><p> </p><p>In a preview for the Spike series <i>Life Or Debt</i>, <b>Aaron Carter </b>opens up about the financial turmoil he has endured as an adult after finding fame as a child star in the &#x2018;90s.</p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="1"></wm:embed><p>&quot;Financially, I&apos;m in a terrible position,&quot; Carter, 28, tells financial advisor Victor Antonio in the sneak peek above. &quot;When I turned 18, I got hit with all those taxes. I filed a Chapter 7 bankruptcy last year; now I&apos;m already over $100,000 in debt.&quot;<br></p><p> </p><p>The &#x201C;Aaron&#x2019;s Party (Come Get It)&#x201D; singer also reflects back on his fateful decision to sign over the millions he made as a kid to his parents, Robert and Jane Carter, to prevent them from going to jail for tax evasion. </p><p></p><wm:media type="photo" id="1"></wm:media><p></p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="2"></wm:embed><p>&quot;Everybody told me not to take the brunt of this bankruptcy,&quot; Carter &#x2014; who owed $1 million in taxes in 2009 &#x2014; recounts in the clip. He also shares that he has no savings to his name and is more than $150,000 in debt.</p><wm:video type="inset" id="1"></wm:video><p>As <i>Us Weekly</i> <a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/aaron-carter-files-for-chapter-7-bankruptcy-positive-step-for-him-says-rep-20132111">previously reported</a>, the younger brother of Backstreet Boys member <b>Nick Carter</b> filed for Chapter 7 bankruptcy in 2013. Legal documents stated that his assets totaled $8,232.16 and his liabilities totaled $2,204,854.</p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="3"></wm:embed><p></p><wm:media type="photo" id="2"></wm:media><p>&#x201C;The bulk of the debt is from over 10 years ago when he was a minor and his money was being managed by other people,&quot; Carter&apos;s rep explained to <i>Us</i> at the time. &quot;Most of that is an IRS tax debt. It&apos;s very old debt from when his money wasn&apos;t in his control. This is not recent problems that happened in the last couple of years, it&apos;s going way back.&quot;<br></p><p> </p><p>Watch the video above. Catch Carter&#x2019;s appearance on<i> Life Or Debt </i>on Spike Sunday, May 15, at 10 p.m. ET.&#xA0;</p><wm:html type="inset" id="1"></wm:html><p><br></p><p>This article originally appeared on www.usmagazine.com: <a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/aaron-carter-opens-up-about-being-150k-in-debt-w206091">Aaron Carter Opens Up About Being $150K in Debt on ‘Life Or Debt’</a></p></content>
	</entry>
	<entry>
		<title>Bam Margera's Parents Admit to Enabling His Self-Destructive Behavior in 'Family Therapy With Dr. Jenn' Sneak Peek</title>
		<link rel="alternative" href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/bam-margeras-parents-admit-to-enabling-him-on-family-therapy-with-dr-jenn-w206015"/>
		<updated>1969-12-31T19:00:00Z</updated>
		<published>2016-05-11T13:52:00Z</published>
		<id>http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/bam-margeras-parents-admit-to-enabling-him-on-family-therapy-with-dr-jenn-w206015</id>
		<summary type="text">In Family Therapy With Dr. Jenn's Wednesday, May 11, episode, Bam Margera's parents acknowledge that they need to stop bailing out their son after his drinking binges — watch Us Weekly's exclusive first look</summary>
		<content type="html"><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">Time for some tough love? In <i>Family Therapy With Dr. Jenn</i>&apos;s Wednesday, May 11, episode, <b>Bam Margera</b>&apos;s parents painfully admit to enabling his reckless behavior, as seen in <i>Us Weekly</i>&apos;s exclusive sneak peek.</span><br></p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="1"></wm:embed><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">The VH1 series&apos; preview clip shows the </span><i style="line-height: 1.42857;">Jackass</i><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"> star, 36, sitting down with Dr. </span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;">Jenn Mann</b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">, who does her best to convince his folks, <b>April</b> and <b>Phil</b>, that they need to toughen up when reacting to their son&apos;s inebriated shenanigans.</span><br></p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="2"></wm:embed><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">April somberly tells Phil, &quot;We are both damage control, you and I, and honestly, if he doesn&apos;t have to pay the consequences for the s--t that he starts, he&apos;s gonna keep doing it, because he never has to clean it up.&quot;</span><br></p><p></p><wm:media type="photo" id="1"></wm:media><p>In previous episodes, Bam admitted that he has increased his drinking binges following the 2011 death of close friend and <i>Jackass </i>cohort <b>Ryan Dunn</b>.</p><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">Watch the tense clip in the video above.</span><br></p><p><i>Family Therapy With Dr. Jenn </i>airs on VH1 Wednesdays at 8 p.m. ET.&#xA0;</p><wm:html type="inset" id="1"></wm:html><p><br></p><p>This article originally appeared on www.usmagazine.com: <a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/bam-margeras-parents-admit-to-enabling-him-on-family-therapy-with-dr-jenn-w206015">Bam Margera's Parents Admit to Enabling His Self-Destructive Behavior in 'Family Therapy With Dr. Jenn' Sneak Peek</a></p></content>
	</entry>
	<entry>
		<title>Gilmore Girls’ Scott Patterson Teases More New Episodes After Netflix Reboot: ‘There’s Room for It to Continue'</title>
		<link rel="alternative" href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/gilmore-girls-scott-patterson-teases-more-new-episodes-after-netflix-reboot-w206055"/>
		<updated>1969-12-31T19:00:00Z</updated>
		<published>2016-05-11T12:22:41Z</published>
		<id>http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/gilmore-girls-scott-patterson-teases-more-new-episodes-after-netflix-reboot-w206055</id>
		<summary type="text">'Gilmore Girls' star Scott Patterson, who plays Luke Danes, says there’s room for more episodes after the Netflix revival — find out more!</summary>
		<content type="html"><p>We never want it to end! <i>Gilmore Girls</i>&#x2019; <b>Scott Patterson</b>, who plays Lorelai&#x2019;s love interest Luke Danes, revealed that they&#x2019;re finishing up the filming for the Netflix revival on Wednesday, May 11, but that the ending leaves room for more episodes. </p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="1"></wm:embed><wm:embed type="related"></wm:embed><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">&#x201C;They&#x2019;re going to be movie quality,&#x201D; he said of the four 90-minute installments on the latest episode of the </span><a href="http://www.gilmoreguysshow.com/" style="line-height: 1.42857; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">Gilmore Guys podcast</a><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">. &#x201C;I felt like I was walking on a </span><b style="line-height: 1.42857;">Michael Bay</b><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"> set.&#x2026;Everything seems bigger, better. It feels like a feature film.&#x201D;</span><br></p><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">As for the ending of the reboot, Patterson said &quot;it&#x2019;s not necessarily a cliffhanger,&#x201D; but it could leave fans wanting more. &#x201C;There&#x2019;s room for more. It didn&#x2019;t end, but maybe it did,&#x201D; he teased. As for whether the show will continue on: &#x201C;I&#x2019;m thinking it&#x2019;s like 50/50 on that.&#x2026;People have been intimating that they would want it to continue and there&#x2019;s room for it to continue.&#x201D;</span><br></p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="2"></wm:embed><p>Thankfully, he&#x2019;s totally on board for more episodes. &quot;I would hope that there would be more. I thought the best job I ever had was 2000 to 2007 on the show. This is better,&#x201D; he continued. </p><p></p><p></p><wm:media type="photo" id="1"></wm:media><p></p><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">Patterson, 57, revealed the biggest difference between filming the original CW series and the recent episodes is that they appreciate it more now. &#x201C;We&#x2019;re more grateful to have the opportunity to reprise the roles. It reminds us of what we had,&#x201D; he told the Gilmore Guys podcast. &quot;We were younger then, and we were maybe a little bit na&#xEF;ve about the business, but now we&#x2019;re more experienced, and it&#x2019;s just very satisfying and it&#x2019;s a good group of people to come back to. People are closer now. The friendships are deeper.&#x201D;</span><br></p><wm:video type="inset" id="1"></wm:video><p><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">He said it also changes the atmosphere that <b>Amy Sherman-Palladino</b> and <b>Daniel Palladino</b>, the original creators of <i>Gilmore Girls</i>, are on set every day, because they weren&#x2019;t always present when filming the original. &#x201C;When they would come on set, it would energize the entire place,&#x201D; Patterson recalled.</span><br></p><p></p><wm:embed type="inset" id="3"></wm:embed><p>While he can&#x2019;t reveal too many spoilers, Patterson did say the fans are going to love the continuation of the story. &#x201C;They&#x2019;re going to be ecstatic,&#x201D; he said. &quot;It hasn&#x2019;t lost any of its original charm at all.&quot;</p><wm:html type="inset" id="1"></wm:html><p><br></p><p>This article originally appeared on www.usmagazine.com: <a href="http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/gilmore-girls-scott-patterson-teases-more-new-episodes-after-netflix-reboot-w206055">Gilmore Girls’ Scott Patterson Teases More New Episodes After Netflix Reboot: ‘There’s Room for It to Continue'</a></p></content>
	</entry>
</feed>
